Class CurrentOrderController

java.lang.Object
com.example.project4rupizzeria.CurrentOrderController
public class CurrentOrderController extends Object
This class is meant to manage all the event handling in the CurrentOrders interface. It allows the user to remove pizzas and place the order.

  • Constructor Details

    • CurrentOrderController

      public CurrentOrderController()

  • Method Details

    • placeOrder

      void placeOrder()
      Creates the Order object using the list of pizzas and adds it to the list of Orders. Pops up an alert window when the order is placed, but if there are no pizzas, informs the user to add pizzas to the order.

    • clearOrder

      void clearOrder()
      Removes all pizzas from the order and displays default values for all controllers.

    • removePizza

      void removePizza()
      Removes the selected pizza from the display list and ArrayList of Pizza objects. Updates the subtotal, sales tax, and total order.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the scene to immediately display information for the order.

    • displaySubtotal

      private void displaySubtotal()
      Displays the subtotal rounded to 2 decimal points.

    • displayOrderTotal

      private void displayOrderTotal()
      Displays the total price rounded to 2 decimal points.

    • displaySalesTax

      private void displaySalesTax()
      Displays the tax rounded to 2 decimal points.

    • displayOrderNumber

      private void displayOrderNumber()
      Displays the order number for the order.

    • displayPizzas

      private void displayPizzas()
      Displays the list of Pizzas in the order with their description.

    • createAlert

      private void createAlert(String title, String header, String content)
      Creates a pop-up window alert that informs the user of any important action they should take.
      Parameters:
      title - - the title of the alert shown on the window.
      header - - the main error/update conveyed to the user.
      content - - the information about the alert, giving instructions or describing the alert.

    • backToMenu

      void backToMenu(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws IOException
      Allows the user to return back to the main menu when the button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - - the event of the mouse being clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - - input/output exception when the proper file isn't received.
